page.title: 16FARMING.
page.content: Farming is the main industry in this area.It has become highly mechanized over recent years with the result that far fewer men are employed. Intensive farming means widespread use of sprays and fertilisers.Many farmers feel this is overdone,causing overproduction of cereal crops,and some feel a quota should be set.There is still a great need for small farms,especially tenant farms,since there are at the moment few openings for young people. Most farmers accept E.E.C. farming policies with reservations,feeling that there is much bad management of resources, with little consideration for small farmers. The majority of farmers in this area are conservationists,retaining hedges where practicable and planting trees. Stubble burning is on the decline due to national outcry.
